attributes.action: make people who smoke or drink heavily pay for NHS treatment
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
It has been proven that cigarette smoke and excessive alcohol drinking is detrimental to health. 

Poor health increases the risk of certain illnesses developing, increasing the need for such people to visit the doctor more, therefore costing the NHS.

With almost all private medical insurance policies, premiums are much higher for those who smoke, or drink excessively.

The regular tax payer should not have to foot the bill for these people. 

They should instead pay (a subsidised amount) for their NHS treatment for illness or emergencies directly caused by the either of the above factors.
